results.title: Merrily we roll along
results.creator_credit: Robert L Bendick and Xerox Films
results.brief_description: Presents a rare combination of historical accuracy and humorous entertainment in an informal history of America’s love affair with automobiles. Narrated by Groucho Marx.

results.title: Understanding alcohol: use and abuse
results.creator_credit: Tad Stones and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Discusses the physical, mental and social effects of alcohol and describes the four stages of inebriation. Examines the various factors which may lead to the use and abuse of alcohol. Narrated by Ralph Story.

results.title: More than blood and bandages
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Nicholas Cockram, Slater Studios and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A documentary designed to make the public aware of the variety of activities in which the Red Cross is involved. Shows the Red Cross responding to the needs of the sick, the handicapped, the disabled and the distressed.

results.title: Body talk
results.brief_description: Explores the world of nonverbal communication using arms, feet, fingers, hands, and head. Includes spoken introduction and some mime. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Gruesome gray monster (Finding colours)
results.brief_description: Designed to sharpen perception and appreciation of colour. Shows the experiences of a young girl who goes to the castle of the gruesome gray monster to recover the colours he has stolen from the world.

results.title: Mammals
results.brief_description: Identifies through both common and uncommon examples, those chracteristics that set mammals apart from all other animals. Also shows that household pets may be relatives of large, wild animals. No other credits available. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Learning about reptiles
results.brief_description: Identifies biological characteristics, adaptations and eating habits of turtles, alligators, crocodiles, snakes, lizards and tortoises. Illustrates the versatility of these animals to adapt to environments ranging from harsh deserts to oceans. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
